p: In contrast to the other vegetable oils with Δ 5-sterols (β-sitosterol, campesterol, and stigmasterol) as the major components, Wenzl et al. [ 45] showed that pumpkin seed oil contains specific Δ 7-phytosterols, typical of only a few plant families (e.g., Cucurbitaceae), that provide a fingerprint for detection of adulteration. These Δ 7-sterols are supposed to give the pumpkin seed oil a beneficial effect in the treatment and prophylaxis of disorders of the prostate gland and the urinary bladder [ 46].
